reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel during midsummer holidays. The hotel has a very good internet site, so I will not repeat what is already mentioned there.
reviews.title: Average hotel from an international perspective

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One Haag to note that the hotel takes advantage of beautiful and serene surroundings that do not belong to they hotel. Proximity to the large midsummer gathering is a plus. You can enjoy now activities nearby like canoe riding, nice children playground and cut wood for drilling. We especially liked the children's mini-zoo. They had sheep chicken, hampster, rabbits ans geese. The playground and the surroundings were clean.
reviews.title: A nice location with a lot of activities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were extremely dull. The breakfast was average on an international scale however better than other Swedish hotels. Just like other Swedish hotel no AC. No real room service. No lunch on Sundays or major holidays! Bikes for rent are available but not with saddle for children. Very small pool with difficulty getting towels. The world's smallest gym with only three machines ans three dumb bells. Green wet and dry sauna with the former being mixed, although very small.
reviews.title: Högbo is very nice but..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You will not hate the place but you will not long to come back to.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: have spent a week in Högbo for business and have fully enjoyed the stay. It was just snowing so a bit freezy altough we got one of the cottages some 500 m away from the central building. But a perfect place also in those conditions. Have been there also in summer and enjoyed that as well.
reviews.title: Like going back in time
